about the 2008 Detroit Lions
unlike the Owen 16 Browns who were built
to fail the Lions failed in spite of
attempting to build themselves to win
their general manager had been in the
franchise for seven years with very
questionable results but their head
coach Rod Marinelli had just
transitioned his team from 3 and 13 to 7
and 9 in his first two seasons and the
team was talking like they were ready to
be taken seriously again after not
posting a winning record since 2000
unfortunately for them the absolute
inverse occurred their point
differential at negative 241 is one of
the worst in NFL history
allowing over 32 points per game on
average in each and every contest while
in many ways they were quantifiably
worse than the 2017 Browns like total
offense total defense or even scoring
defense their legacy will also carry a
longer lasting impression the closest
game they played all year was a 12 to 10

where did the Vikings get those two
points to edged out the Lions you ask
well from a self-inflicted safety from
Lions quarterback Dan Orlovsky who
avoided being sacked by Jared Allen by
simply running out of the back of the
end zone it's still the perfect image of
the 2008 Lions train wreck of a season
self-inflicted suffering to the highest
degree let's also not forget that they
had one of the greatest receiving
talents of all time in Calvin Johnson
playing for them who accounted for over
31 percent of all yardage generated by
the Lions offense over the course of the
season in just his second year to make
matters worse on Thanksgiving Day they
were beaten down in their own Stadium
47:10 by the Tennessee Titans in front

nation there's no one that wants to
watch that with Grandma this wasn't just
a bad team it was a broken one
fundamentally that went through three

season with the affirmation Calvin
Johnson
and still managed the third lease
passing yards in the entire NFL but it
went beyond the football field to one of
the biggest headlines out of Detroit all
year was an instance where defensive
coordinator Joe Barry was brought up to
their head coach who happened to be his
father-in-law
the question that began a media circus
was do you ever wish your daughter
married a better defensive coordinator
that was certainly a below the knees
blow and the writer responsible would
later resign as he probably should have
but it all goes to show how pathetic the
2008 lions were they didn't respect
themselves and they weren't respected by
anybody else either and in the end
coupling that with the fact that no one
expected them to be that horrific makes
them the worst team in NFL history so
there you have it a quick rundown of the
most terrible teams to take in NFL field
but even though the 2008 Lions are a
tough act to follow
as NFL history presses on there is only
one thing that the football gods
